intro: Terminalia laurinoides, commonly known as African snowball, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in spherical clusters, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open woodlands. Terminalia laurinoides is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in local medicine.
